results.title: Shantiniketan: Abode of Peace
results.creator_credit: A P Sinha, K Samarth, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: In 1901, there was established at Shantiniketan an institution for boys and girls, where education was in close communion with nature. Twenty years later, the institution had grown to such proportions that it came to be recognised as an international university, the Visva-Bharati. This film gives an interesting glimpse of Shantiniketan the “Abode of peace”, the school of international culture, established by the Poet Rabindranath Tagore at Bolpur, not far from Calcutta. Languages, sculpture, painting, embroidery, music, dancing and other fine arts are an integral part of training.
results.creator_credit_for_label: A P Sinha, K Samarth, M. Bhavnani and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Shane Warne
results.creator_credit: Stephen Phillips and Australian Cricket Video
results.brief_description: This is the story of Shane Warne’s mercurial career in his own words. Named one of the five greatest cricketers of the 20th century and Australia’s greatest wicket taker in Test cricket, he commentates on footage of most of the highlights of his career so far, including his Test debut against India in 1991/92, the Test match hat-trick, and the 1999 World Cup victory. He also discusses many amusing behind the scenes tales as well as some of his greatest rivals.

results.title: Shakespeare's theatre: The Globe Playhouse
results.creator_credit: Mildred Jordon, William Jordan and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Shows a model reconstruction of the Globe Playhouse, illustrating the separate stages, machinery, fixed scenery and acting conventions in brief extracts from Shakespeare’s plays as they were probably first performed. Incldues excerpts from Julius Caesar, Hamlet, Macbeth, Twelfth Night and Romeo and Juliet.

results.title: Shadows of the peacock = Echoes of paradise
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Jane Scott and Laughing Kookaburra Productions
results.brief_description: A married woman, and mother of three youngsters, is devastated by the infidelities of her philandering husband, which coincides with the death of her beloved father. With the view to reassess her life, she absconds to Thailand where she falls for a beautiful Balinese dancer. Despite her enjoyment of sexual fulfilment, freedom to explore her desire, and space for reflection away from her conventional suburban life, Maria is conflicted about her maternal duties and obligations. This interesting, early work by Phillip Noyce, intelligently probes the themes of female independence, motherhood and female sexuality within the context of ‘the other’ in this case being Maria’s lover. Maria questions her attraction in light of his exoticism and culture, which contrasts sharply to her rigid upbringing. Stars a young Claudia Karvan as Maria’s daughter. Also known as “Echoes of paradise”.

results.title: Shadows of our forgotten ancestors = Wild Horses of Fire
results.brief_description: Shadows of our forgotten ancestors was the film with which the Armenian Sergo Paradjanov first came to fame in the West. The story, drawn from Carpathian folklore, and set amongst the Huzul people, is a fairly conventional tale of blighted love, but what really distinguishes the film is its flamboyant visual style, its florid romanticism and its delirious pantheism - none of which endeared it to the Soviet authorities. The story begins with a blodd feud between two village clans, the wealthy Gutenyuks and the poor Pallicuks, and ends with a fight to death between two men. The film is a jungian parable: the ‘pure’ shepherd Ivan (Ivan Mikolaichuk) quest for reunion with is own ‘anima’, as represented by true love Marichka (Larissa Kadochnikova). Adpated from novel by Mikhail Kotzubinsky. In Ukrainian with English sub-titles. See also: Paradjanov’s “Caucasus Trilogy”: The Colour of Pomegranates & The Legend of the Suram Fortress. Ashik Kerib.

results.title: Shadows
results.brief_description: This film is a personal journey, a form of diary that ventures into the territory of the unconscious. It is based upon the exploration of the body’s movements whilst asleep. “Shadows” was shot over two consecutive nights during real sleep. With Adam Briscomb and D.M. Parrish. No commentary - music performed by Dalmonico Babari and Ronny Reinhard.

results.title: Shame
results.creator_credit: Steve Steve Jodrell, Damien Parer, Paul D. Barron, Barron Films and UAA Films
results.brief_description: Asta Cadell (Deborra-Lee Furness), a city barrister is touring the outback alone when she is forced to stay in a small, isolated town when her motorbike breaks down. During her enforced stay she uncovers the scandal that grips the town in fear, and becomes the catalyst for a dramatic and riveting battle. A disturbing look at the sexual attitudes of an Australian rural society in decline. Also stars Simone Buchanan and Tony Barry.

results.title: Give sharks a chance
results.creator_credit: Richard Dennison, John Gau Productions, National Geographic Society and Orana Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Blue wilderness”.
After a series of shark attacks on the Gold Coast, Ron and Valerie Taylor, try to curb an outbreak of hysteria, and take a group of people, including two shark attack victims, to confront the object of their fears face to face.

results.title: Shakti - 'She is vital energy'
results.creator_credit: Monique Crouillere, Anne-Claire Poirier and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Through a succession of mini-portraits, this documentary portrays a woman of rural India whose life, shaped by tradition and ritual, still follows a pre-determined course. Images of great visual beauty illustrate the various stages of her evolution, from childhood to old age. Her marriage to a young man of her parents’ choice is a turning point in her life. She must leave her family to become a member of her husband’s family. The woman of rural India moves through life with grace and dignity, regardless of the tasks she must perform. Voice and narration: Kelly Ricard.
